projects.title: 3E (Energy, Environment and Economic) Modelling and Analysis of National Electricity System for Finland using LEAP
projects.description: Finland is making remarkable strides towards becoming a leader in sustainable energy, boasting the highest SDG index in the world and achieving its SDG 7 targets. However, the country still faces a significant challenge in achieving SDG 13, particularly with respect to the target for CO2 emissions from fossil fuel combustion per capita indicator. To tackle this challenge, the Finnish government has released a national climate and energy strategy with an ambitious goal of becoming carbon-neutral by 2035. To support decision-makers in developing effective policies to achieve this goal, a comprehensive 3-E analysis of Finland's national electricity system was conducted. This study explored three scenarios, including a Business-as-Usual scenario, a Netzero-emissions scenario, and an Own Vision scenario, which took into account the complete electrification of the road and rail transportation sectors. The findings reveal that while demand and power generation capacity will increase, the social costs associated with the transition will vary across the scenarios. Nonetheless, Finland is well-positioned to succeed in creating a carbon-neutral future by 2035, and comprehensive examination and informed assessment of future pathways can optimize this transition.

projects.title: The socio-economic and environmental consequences of Ireland's net-zero energy transition
projects.description: This project provides a comprehensive analysis of sustainability aspects towards a net zero future in Ireland. The study develops seven indicators using the OpenENTRANCE tool to capture the triple bottom line of sustainability, which were then analyzed in various scenarios to reach climate-neutrality. It also addresses the projected effects of these indicators, including the decarbonization of the transport sector, adoption of renewable energy, the importance of grid stability, carbon pricing, and land-use for bioenergy production. The findings of this study is targeted for the Citizen's Assembly of Ireland towards decision-making on sustainability, as it highlights the significance of stakeholder engagement and the need to employ decision-making methodologies such as multi-criteria analysis to ensure a rational participation in the decision-making process.

projects.title: Underground: A seasonal storage for renewable electricity in densely populated regions
projects.description: Sweden has one of the highest density of ground source heat pumps in the world and recent studies indicate that the thermal influence of neighbouring boreholes may lead to a drastic decrease in the underground temperature in the long term. One way to tackle this issue is by dumping the heat available during the summer months into the ground by using a heat pump in the reverse mode and thereby also satisfy the cooling demand in buildings. The aim of this project was to simulate and perform a techno-economic analysis of potential pathways to conduct the same.

projects.title: High-Performance Fluorophore Infused Organic Substrates for Solar Photovoltaics
projects.description: In this project, a unique method to enhance the optical properties of a Pectin-PMMA composite substrate was explored by introducing a fluorophore into the material. The results showed that the addition of fluorophore significantly improved the substrate's ability to block UVB light by over 99%, which could help reduce thermalization losses in solar cells. The fluorescence spectroscopy of PSBF substrates also revealed fluorescence in the 400-480 nm wavelength range, potentially contributing to the substrate's increased transparency and photocurrent production in solar cells. While there was no impact on the substrate's haze in the visible zone, this study establishes the concept of enhancing substrate properties through fluorophore infusion, with the potential for further development using alternative fluorophores with better quantum yields.

profile_positions.description:
My role involves the optimization of the Indium Tin Oxide (ITO) TCO layer deposition using Magnetron Sputtering for 2-terminal Perovskite/PERC tandem solar cells. The main objective of the study was to optimize the front ITO layer deposition along with screen-printed metallization on Perovskite Solar Cells using widely adopted industrial tools. 

Key achievements:

•	Successfully optimized the ITO layer properties for tandem solar cell application through rigorous thin-film characterization methods (Hall-effect, Ellipsometry, UV-vis spectroscopy, XRD, etc.)., at low temperatures (140 degreeC), resulting in enhanced layer properties.
•	Established excellent contact resistivity of ITO with screen printed silver contributing to the improvement of solar cell efficiency.
•	Demonstrated expertise in evaluating EQE and I-V characteristics, achieving Voc's of 1.75 V for large area wafers (M2 size) with commercial tools.
